item.title: Dead fox between on slip road and A417, 6th May
item.description:
Dead fox between A417 main road and lanes to A46 Seen around 16:45 on Tuesday 6th May.

item.description:
On the concrete apron in the area outside number 14

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wincel Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely high grass and weeds blocking motorists vision., 6th May
item.description:
Grass verges along Finlay Way and verges and islands on Bishops Cleeve bypass have not been cut at all yet this year - despite other larger public areas of grass having been cut two or three times. These are now causing visibility problems for motorists as well as looking extremely untidy and uncared for. Tewkesbury Borough Council have always cut the verges up until this year. I have been informed by them that they are no longer taking responsibility for verges and Islands and that it is now for the land owner to attend to. They inform me that that is Gloucestershire County Council. Having left the grass for so long, when it is cut there will inevitably be a resultant mess - likely to block gutters and drains. When will Gloucestershire County Council take responsibility for completing this work and for maintaining the verges on a regular basis for the remainder of the summer - as local residents would expect?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finlay Way, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several potholes in this location, 6th May
item.description:
Also outside Glan Nant house, next door to Green Gables

item.title: Visibility blocked for car drivers by long grass. This is in the chicane section, particularly on the western side of the road, 6th May
item.description:
Itâ€™s the stretch of road within the chicane section near the new community centre building. It is becoming dangerous for drivers of cars entering the chicane heading towards Cleeve as they cannot see if the road ahead is clear.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gotherington Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
